body_html:
I am using python 3.6, pytorch 0.3.0, cuda 8.0 and ubuntu 17.04 on a system with two 1080Ti and 32GB RAM.

When I use 8 workers for my own dataset, I frequently see the deadlock (it happens in the first epoch). When I reduce the workers to 4, it disappears (I ran 80 epochs).

When deadlock happens, I still have ~10GB free on RAM.
body_text:
I am using python 3.6, pytorch 0.3.0, cuda 8.0 and ubuntu 17.04 on a system with two 1080Ti and 32GB RAM.
When I use 8 workers for my own dataset, I frequently see the deadlock (it happens in the first epoch). When I reduce the workers to 4, it disappears (I ran 80 epochs).
When deadlock happens, I still have ~10GB free on RAM.
body:
I am using python 3.6, pytorch 0.3.0, cuda 8.0 and ubuntu 17.04 on a system with two 1080Ti and 32GB RAM.

When I use 8 workers for my own dataset, I frequently see the deadlock (it happens in the first epoch). When I reduce the workers to 4, it disappears (I ran 80 epochs).

When deadlock happens, I still have ~10GB free on RAM.

![screenshot from 2018-03-02 19-57-47](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/508130/36908209-093dc2fe-1e54-11e8-9b9b-46619a347fec.png)
